content: Hello, friends. As I've started studying Category Theory, I noticed that it seems that there are not many brazilians working on the subject. I was wondering if there were any more brazilians over here. I'd love to get in touch and learn more about who is doing Category Theory here in Brazil.

hi, @José Siqueira and myself are some of the Brazilians over here. There are also "brasileiros do coração" like @Peter Arndt , and @Juan Ferrer Meleiro who's a student of Prof Hugo Mariano at USP. there was a big meeting last year in CT in Brazil and we're organizing a thematic session in CT in https://sites.google.com/view/ecbpm/sess%C3%B5es-tem%C3%A1ticas with our Portuguese colleagues Prof Maria Manuel Clementino and the group in Coimbra.
Great to know! Didn't know about the event. I'm registering for attendance right now.

Valeria de Paiva said:

there was a big meeting last year in CT in Brazil

Are you referring to last year's "Encontro Brasileiro em Teoria das Categorias"? If so, for anyone who is interested, there are video recordings here!
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv60Km4sJ-ZDx0mUFHHUkyg/videos

yes, indeed I was referring to this @Paolo Perrone . Thanks for getting the info! there were more than 200 people registered for this meeting!

I should add that I know several other people here who are Brazilians, but I didn't want to mention them, because I don't know if they want to be put in the spotlight. I know I could say so about @José Siqueira (or rather I hope he doesn't mind me).
Hi @Davi Sales Barreira! I’m from UFRJ. I’m currently working on how to use string diagrams in education (i.e. Graphical Linear Algebra).
Hi! There is also a portuguese language stream here.
Don't mind at all Valeria, happy to hear about more Brazilians fitting into the diagram :) Warm welcomes to @Davi Sales Barreira and @Joao Paixao!
Hi @Davi Sales Barreira. I am undergraduate student at UESC, Bahia. I have been studying category theory for many years.
